metadata.title: CVE-2017-11600 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
net/xfrm/xfrm_policy.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.3, whenCONFIG_XFRM_MIGRATE is enabled, does not ensure that the dir value ofxfrm_userpolicy_id is XFRM_POLICY_MAX or less, which allows local users tocause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via an XFRM_MSG_MIGRATE xfrm Netlink message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1002-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1030-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
